article_text:
Abbott Laboratories continued to struggle in the fourth quarter with challenges in overseas markets, including the continued fallout from a recall that has damaged Abbott's baby-formula products in Asia and a weakened European economy that pressured sales of generic drugs.

Abbott, which also makes medical devices and diagnostics, said sales rose 0.4% to $5.65 billion in the quarter from $5.63 billion in the year-earlier quarter. Net profit fell 44% to $589 million, or 37 cents a share, from $1.05 billion, or 66 cents a...

twitter.description: Abbott Laboratories said its fourth-quarter profit declined, hurt by the spinoff of its AbbVie business, but growth in other areas was solid.
twitter.creator: @joewalkerWSJ

image.alt: Abbott Labs profit falls 44%, hurt by impacts from AbbVie spinoff. $ABT

twitter.title: Abbott Labs Reports 44% Profit Decline

article_summary:
Net profit fell 44% to $589 million, or 37 cents a share, from $1.05 billion, or 66 cents a...
Abbott, which also makes medical devices and diagnostics, said sales rose 0.4% to $5.65 billion in the quarter from $5.63 billion in the year-earlier quarter.
Abbott Laboratories continued to struggle in the fourth quarter with challenges in overseas markets, including the continued fallout from a recall that has damaged Abbott's baby-formula products in Asia and a weakened European economy that pressured sales of generic drugs.
